questions.question: Which factor makes up the largest percentage of a traditional FICO credit score?
questions.explanation: Payment history contributes roughly 35% of a FICO score, making on-time payments the top priority.

questions.question: To keep utilization healthy, what ceiling should you target on each revolving account?
questions.explanation: Staying under 30% (and ideally under 10%) of a card's limit sends a positive signal to scoring models.

questions.question: When reviewing a credit report, which section reveals who has checked your credit recently?
questions.explanation: The inquiries section shows soft and hard pulls so you can confirm only authorized parties accessed your data.

questions.question: Which dispute strategy best documents that a late payment was reported in error?
options: Calling the lender with no paperwork
Submitting screenshots of your budgeting app
Mailing the bureaus a certified letter with statements showing on-time payments
Waiting 90 days to see if it auto-corrects
questions.explanation: Certified mail plus supporting statements builds a paper trail and compels bureaus to investigate.

questions.question: Closing your oldest credit card will typically shorten your average age of accounts and may lower your score.
questions.explanation: Length of history matters, so preserve seasoned accounts unless fees are unavoidable.

questions.question: Which payoff method maximizes interest savings regardless of motivation level?
questions.explanation: The avalanche targets the highest APR first, reducing total interest paid across balances.

questions.question: When building a payoff tracker, which data point helps you verify progress month to month?
options: Balance, interest paid, and remaining payoff timeline
questions.explanation: Tracking balance and interest lets you validate that principal is shrinking every cycle.

questions.question: Applying for several new credit cards within a short window can temporarily depress your score even if you are approved.
questions.explanation: Clusters of hard inquiries lower scores in the near term and may suggest elevated risk to lenders.

questions.question: Becoming an authorized user on a seasoned account is most useful when the primary account holder...
options: Has a long history and low utilization
Carries a balance near the limit
questions.explanation: A positive history with low utilization can be inherited, boosting your own score foundation.

questions.question: Which monitoring habit keeps soft inquiries from turning into hard pulls without your consent?
options: Reviewing your credit reports at least three times per year
Opting out of credit monitoring services
questions.explanation: Staggering report pulls every four months lets you spot unauthorized activity before damage spreads.
